ai.summary: Lea Valley Circle is a 12.3 km circular hike in the UK with moderate difficulty. The route weaves along the Lea valley through a mix of riverbank paths, woodlands, and occasional urban stretches, offering varied scenery and relatively gentle elevation changes suitable for experienced hikers seeking a full day out.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail features mixed terrain: well-maintained footpaths, compact gravel, sections of muddy track after rain, short gentle ascents, and level riverbank flats. Expect occasional steps, boardwalks, and some urban perimeter sections.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for UK weather and limited daylight in winter; wear sturdy footwear with good grip; stay on marked paths and respect private property; carry a map, compass or GPS, and a fully charged phone; bring water and snacks; check for seasonal closures and flooding after heavy rain; let someone know your route and expected return time; be mindful of other walkers and cyclists on shared sections.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots or shoes with good grip
Weather-appropriate clothing (layers, waterproof jacket, hat and gloves if cold)
Map and compass or GPS device
Phone with offline maps and a portable charger
Lightweight rain cover for your pack

seo.title: Lea Valley Circle – 12.3 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover Lea Valley Circle, a 12.3 km moderate hike in the UK. Learn terrain, safety tips, gear checklist, and the best seasons to hike this route.
